greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the value of a nonregular continued fraction giving tau/(3*tau-1), where tau is the Prouhet-Thue-Morse constant.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 6.8 Prouhet-Thue-Morse Constant, p. 437.
mathematica: (* 10 terms suffice to get 103 correct digits *) t = Fold[Function[2^2^#2 - (2^2^#2 - 1)/#1], 2, Reverse[Range[0, 10]]]; RealDigits[t, 10, 103] // First
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 01 2014
